alert.note: Alert for Imperial County Southwest (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued May 27 at 1:35PM PDT until May 29 at 8:00AM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 AM PDT SATURDAY... ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM SATURDAY TO 8 AM PDT SUNDAY... ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM SUNDAY TO 2 AM PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...West-southwest winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45-55 mph expected. * WHERE...Southwest corner of Imperial County. * WHEN...For the first Wind Advisory, from 7 PM this evening to 5 AM PDT Saturday. For the second Wind Advisory, from 3 PM Saturday to 8 AM PDT Sunday. For the third Wind Advisory, from 5 PM Sunday to 2 AM PDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Difficult driving conditions, especially for larger vehicles traveling along roads with crosswinds. Light, unsecured objects may become airborne. Minor tree damage possible.
info.instruction: A Wind Advisory means that sustained wind speeds of between 30 and 40 mph are expected, or wind gusts of between 40 and 58 mph. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. In addition, strong winds over desert areas could result in briefly lowered visibilities to well under a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand. Use extra caution.
